text: The correct answer is "It confirmed the existence of invisible 'minute creatures', which could not be seen by the naked eye." The invention of the microscope allowed scientists to observe and study microorganisms that were previously invisible to the naked eye. This led to important discoveries in microbiology, including the existence of bacteria, viruses, and other pathogens that play a crucial role in health and disease. The microscope also allowed scientists to study the structure and function of these microorganisms in more detail, leading to important breakthroughs in our understanding of microbiology and its applications in medicine, agriculture, and many other fields.
